title: On the population size in stochastic differential games. (arXiv:2310.09919v1 [math.PR])
abstract: Commuters looking for the shortest path to their destinations, the security of networked computers, hedge funds trading on the same stocks, governments and populations acting to mitigate an epidemic, or employers and employees agreeing on a contact, are all examples of (dynamic) stochastic differential games. In essence, game theory deals with the analysis of strategic interactions among multiple decision-makers. The theory has had enormous impact in a wide variety of fields, but its rigorous mathematical analysis is rather recent. It started with the pioneering work of von Neumann and Morgenstern published in 1944. Since then, game theory has taken centre stage in applied mathematics and related areas. Game theory has also played an important role in unsuspected areas: for instance in military applications, when the analysis of guided interceptor missiles in the 1950s motivated the study of games evolving dynamically in time. translated_title: 关于随机微分博弈中的人口规模
translated_abstract: 寻找最短路径的通勤者，网络计算机的安全性，对同一股票进行交易的对冲基金，采取措施遏制传染病的政府和人口，或雇主和雇员达成协议，都是（动态）随机微分博弈的例子。本质上，博弈论涉及多个决策者之间的战略互动分析。这个理论在各种领域都有巨大的影响，但其严格的数学分析却是最近才出现的。它始于1944年冯·诺伊曼和摩根斯特恩的开创性工作。从那时起，博弈论在应用数学和相关领域中占据了核心位置。博弈论还在意想不到的领域发挥了重要作用：例如在军事应用中，20世纪50年代对制导拦截飞弹的分析促使了博弈在时间上动态演化的研究。这种可能受到随机性影响的博弈被称为
tldr: 动态随机微分博弈在多个领域有广泛应用，博弈论的数学分析对解决问题起到重要作用。
